definition: Gideon (name, from Judges 6:11-ffoll.)/also written 吉迪恩
suburbs or outskirts/one of the five degrees of official mourning attire in dynastic China/official in charge of fields (old)

sentences.english: Then Gideon the son of Joash returned from the battle by the ascent of Heres.
sentences.chinese: 約阿施的兒子基甸由希列斯坡從陣上回來。

sentences.english: He had seventy sons of his own, for he had many wives.
sentences.chinese: 基甸有七十個親生的兒子，因爲他有許多的妻。

sentences.english: And the weight of the golden earrings that he requested was a thousand and seven hundred shekels of gold;
sentences.chinese: 基甸所要出來的金耳環重一千七百舍客勒金子。

sentences.english: Gideon or Jerubbaal the 6th Judge of Israel.
sentences.chinese: 基甸或耶路巴力是以色列第六位士師。

sentences.english: Gideon made the gold into an ephod, which he placed in Ophrah, his town.
sentences.chinese: 基甸以此製造了一個以弗得，設立在本城俄弗拉。

sentences.english: And Gideon had threescore and ten sons of his body begotten: for he had many wives.
sentences.chinese: 基甸有七十個親生的兒子，因爲他有許多的妻。

sentences.english: Son of Gideon by a concubine in Shechem.
sentences.chinese: 基甸的妾在示劍所生的兒子。

sentences.english: And Gideon made an ephod of it and put it in his city, in Ophrah.
sentences.chinese: 基甸以此製造了一個以弗得，設立在本城俄弗拉。

sentences.english: What did Gideon do to win the victory that night?
sentences.chinese: 基甸那夜做了甚麼，以致能取勝呢？

sentences.english: Gideon never realised what this beautiful golden object might mean.
sentences.chinese: 基甸可能從沒想過，這件精美的金衣會帶來什麼影響。

sentences.english: Gideon son of Joash then returned from the battle by the Pass of Heres.
sentences.chinese: 約阿施的兒子基甸由希列斯坡從陣上回來。

sentences.english: And they contended with him sharply.
sentences.chinese: 他們就與基甸大大的爭鬧。

definition: Jephthah (Hebrew: Yiftach) son of Gilead, Judges 11-foll.
Jehovah (biblical name for God, Hebrew: YHWH)/compare Yahweh 雅威[Ya3 wei1] and God 上帝[Shang4 di4]
Philistine (Palestinian people, reputedly uncircumcised, c. 1,000 BC)
Book of Numbers/Fourth Book of Moses
Abraham (name)/Abraham, father of Judaism and Islam in the Bible and Quran/same as Ibrahim 易卜拉辛
Hezekiah or Ezekias (740-687 BC), twelfth king of Judah (Judaism)
